page.title: 04FARMING
page.content: OUR AREA COMPRISES MAINLY OF TWO FARMS,PENTRECLWYDAU AND HENDREWYDDIL. ALTHOUGH PENTRECLWYDAU OCCUPIES THE FLAT VALLEY FLOOR,IT MAY BE COUNTED AS A HILL FARM.BOTH FARMS CONCENTRATE ON SHEEP AS THEIR MAIN INCOME-CATTLE ARE ALSO KEPT FOR THEIR MEAT.WELSH COB HORSES ARE KEPT AT HENDREWYDDIL FARM.INCOME FROM SHHEP COMES FROM THEIR WOOL AND FROM SELLING YOUNG LAMBS IN LATE SUMMER AND EARLY AUTUMN. LIVESTOCK IS SOLD IN THE MARKET TOWN OF NEATH BUT OTHER MARKETS AFFORD AN OUTLET,PENYCAE IN THE UPPER SWANSEA VALLEY AND PENDERYN NEAR ABERDARE. THERE IS AN ANNUAL LIVESTOCK FAIR AT NEATH IN SEPTEMBER WHICH WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1280. PENTRECLWYDAU SUPPLEMENTS ITS INCOME BY HIRING OUT PLANT MACHINERY.
